016package tech.uom.seshat;
017
018import java.util.Arrays;
019import java.util.Collection;
020import java.util.Collections;
021import java.util.HashSet;
022import java.util.Locale;
023import java.util.Objects;
024import java.util.Set;
025import java.util.logging.Level;
026import java.util.logging.Logger;
027import javax.measure.Unit;
028import javax.measure.Quantity;
029import javax.measure.format.UnitFormat;
030import javax.measure.spi.QuantityFactory;
031import javax.measure.spi.ServiceProvider;
032import javax.measure.spi.SystemOfUnits;
033import javax.measure.spi.SystemOfUnitsService;
034import javax.measure.spi.UnitFormatService;
035
036
037/**
038 * The central point from which all unit services (parsing, formatting, listing, <i>etc</i>) can be obtained.
039 * Seshat does not use this class (Seshat rather uses {@link Units} pre-defined constants and {@link UnitFormat}
040 * directly since they are designed specifically for Seshat needs).
041 * This class is provided for allowing other applications to discover Seshat implementation of JSR-363
042 * without direct dependency. A {@code UnitServices} instance can be obtained by call to {@link #current()}.
043 *
044 * @author  Martin Desruisseaux (Geomatys)
045 * @version 1.0
046 */
047public class UnitServices extends ServiceProvider implements SystemOfUnitsService, UnitFormatService {
048    /**
049     * All system of units known to this provider.
050     * The last element in the array is the default system with all units known to Seshat.
051     */
052    private final UnitRegistry[] systems;
053
054    /**
055     * Creates a new service provider. {@code UnitServices} should not be instantiated
056     * directly unless the caller wants specifically the Seshat implementation.
057     * For obtaining the default implementation, use {@link #current()} instead.
058     */
059    public UnitServices() {
060        systems = new UnitRegistry[] {
061            new UnitRegistry("SI",            UnitRegistry.SI),
062            new UnitRegistry("SI + accepted", UnitRegistry.SI | UnitRegistry.ACCEPTED),
063            new UnitRegistry("Imperial",      UnitRegistry.IMPERIAL),
064            new UnitRegistry("SI + other",    -1)                       // Must be last.
065        };
066    }
067
068    /**
069     * Returns the default system of units used by Seshat.
070     * This include the International System of Units (SI) together with some imperial units and other units.
071     * This system includes at least all the constants defined in the {@link Units} class.
072     *
073     * @return the system of units used by Seshat.
074     */
075    @Override
076    public SystemOfUnits getSystemOfUnits() {
077        return systems[systems.length - 1];
078    }
079
080    /**
081     * Returns the system of units having the specified name, or {@code null} if none.
082     * The argument can be any name in the following table:
083     *
084     * <table class="sis">
085     *   <caption>Available system of units</caption>
086     *   <tr><th>Name</th>          <th>Examples</th></tr>
087     *   <tr><td>SI</td>            <td>m, km, m³, s, m∕s, K, °C, hPa, rad, µrad</td></tr>
088     *   <tr><td>SI + accepted</td> <td>s, min, h, m∕s, km∕h, °, ′, ″, ha</td></tr>
089     *   <tr><td>Imperial</td>      <td>in, ft, mi (statute mile)</td></tr>
090     *   <tr><td>SI + other</td>    <td>m, m∕s, km∕h, ft, mi, M (nautical mile)</td></tr>
091     * </table>
092     *
093     * The search for name is case-insensitive and ignore whitespaces.
094     *
095     * @param  name  the name of the desired system of units.
096     * @return the system of units for the given name, or {@code null} if none.
097     */
098    @Override
099    public SystemOfUnits getSystemOfUnits(final String name) {
100        Objects.requireNonNull(name);
101        for (final UnitRegistry s : systems) {
102            if (name.equalsIgnoreCase(s.name)) {
103                return s;
104            }
105        }
106        return null;
107    }
108
109    /**
110     * Returns the list of all available systems of units.
111     *
112     * @return list of available systems of units.
113     */
114    @Override
115    public Collection<SystemOfUnits> getAvailableSystemsOfUnits() {
116        return Collections.unmodifiableList(Arrays.asList(systems));
117    }
118
119    /**
120     * Returns the service to obtain a {@link SystemOfUnits} instances.
121     * The default implementation returns {@code this} since this {@code UnitServices} class
122     * implements directly all relevant interfaces. The methods related to system of units are:
123     *
124     * <ul>
125     *   <li>{@link #getSystemOfUnits()}</li>
126     *   <li>{@link #getSystemOfUnits(String)}</li>
127     *   <li>{@link #getAvailableSystemsOfUnits()}</li>
128     * </ul>
129     *
130     * @return the service to obtain a {@link SystemOfUnits}, or {@code null} if none.
131     */
132    @Override
133    public SystemOfUnitsService getSystemOfUnitsService() {
134        return this;
135    }
136
137    /**
138     * Returns an unit format instance for human-readable unit symbols in the default locale.
139     * The format style is {@link tech.uom.seshat.UnitFormat.Style#SYMBOL}.
140     * This style requires support for Unicode characters;
141     * for example square metres are formatted as “m²”, not “m2”.
142     *
143     * @return a {@link tech.uom.seshat.UnitFormat} instance for unit symbols.
144     */
145    @Override
146    public UnitFormat getUnitFormat() {
147        return new tech.uom.seshat.UnitFormat(Locale.getDefault(Locale.Category.FORMAT));
148    }
149
150    /**
151     * Returns the unit format for the given name. The argument can be the name of
152     * any value in the {@link tech.uom.seshat.UnitFormat.Style} enumeration.
153     * The argument can be any name in the following table:
154     *
155     * <table class="sis">
156     *   <caption>Available unit format name</caption>
157     *   <tr><th>Name</th>      <th>Examples</th></tr>
158     *   <tr><td>SYMBOL</td>    <td>km, m³, m∕s, N⋅m, K, °C, hPa, rad, µrad</td></tr>
159     *   <tr><td>UCUM</td>      <td>km, m3, m/s, N.m</td></tr>
160     *   <tr><td>NAME</td>      <td>kilometre, cubic metre, metres per second</td></tr>
161     * </table>
162     *
163     * The {@code "NAME"} format is locale-sensitive. The format locale can be modified by a call
164     * to {@link tech.uom.seshat.UnitFormat#setLocale(Locale)} on the returned object.
165     *
166     * @param  name the name of the desired format.
167     * @return the corresponding unit format, or {@code null} if none.
168     */
169    @Override
170    public UnitFormat getUnitFormat(String name) {
171        final Locale locale = Locale.getDefault(Locale.Category.FORMAT);
172        name = name.toUpperCase(locale).trim();
173        final tech.uom.seshat.UnitFormat.Style style;
174        try {
175            style = tech.uom.seshat.UnitFormat.Style.valueOf(name);
176        } catch (IllegalArgumentException e) {
177            // JSR-363 specification mandate that we return null.
178            Logger.getLogger("tech.uom.seshat").log(Level.FINE, e.toString(), e);
179            return null;
180        }
181        tech.uom.seshat.UnitFormat f = new tech.uom.seshat.UnitFormat(locale);
182        f.setStyle(style);
183        return f;
184    }
185
186    /**
187     * Returns a list of available format names. The default implementation returns the names
188     * of all values in the {@link tech.uom.seshat.UnitFormat.Style} enumeration.
189     *
190     * @return list of available formats.
191     */
192    @Override
193    public Set<String> getAvailableFormatNames() {
194        final Set<String> names = new HashSet<>(4);
195        for (final Enum<?> e : tech.uom.seshat.UnitFormat.Style.values()) {
196            names.add(e.name());
197        }
198        return names;
199    }
200
201    /**
202     * Returns the service to obtain a {@link UnitFormat} instances.
203     * The default implementation returns {@code this} since this {@code UnitServices} class
204     * implements directly all relevant interfaces. The methods related to unit formats are:
205     *
206     * <ul>
207     *   <li>{@link #getUnitFormat()}</li>
208     *   <li>{@link #getUnitFormat(String)}</li>
209     *   <li>{@link #getAvailableFormatNames()}</li>
210     * </ul>
211     *
212     * @return the service to obtain a {@link UnitFormat}, or {@code null} if none.
213     */
214    @Override
215    public UnitFormatService getUnitFormatService() {
216        return this;
217    }
218
219    /**
220     * Return a factory for the given {@code Quantity} type. In the particular case of Seshat implementation,
221     * {@link Quantities#create(double, Unit)} provides a more direct way to instantiate quantities.
222     *
223     * @param  <Q>   compile-time value of the {@code type} argument.
224     * @param  type  type of the desired the quantity.
225     * @return the service to obtain {@link Quantity} instances, or {@code null} if none.
226     *
227     * @see Quantities#create(double, Unit)
228     */
229    @Override
230    public <Q extends Quantity<Q>> QuantityFactory<Q> getQuantityFactory(final Class<Q> type) {
231        QuantityFactory<Q> factory = Units.get(type);
232        if (factory == null) {
233            factory = new QuantityFactory<Q>() {
234                @Override
235                public Quantity<Q> create(final Number value, final Unit<Q> unit) {
236                    return ScalarFallback.factory(AbstractConverter.doubleValue(value), unit, type);
237                }
238
239                @Override
240                public Unit<Q> getSystemUnit() {
241                    return null;
242                }
243            };
244        }
245        return factory;
246    }
247}
